Could this be related to the fact that the machine runs a single di=
sk?
Using the linux command `sar` shows that the processor spends most of
i=
ts time idle in iowait. Moreover using less threads mitigates the
problem.
=

Thank you
Matteo


--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <go=
jomo@...> wrote:
>
> Is it an average rate of 0KB/sec (but perhaps still a =
trickle of
> completed URIs), or no progress at all (nothing new appearing =
as
> finished in crawl.log)?
>
> Check the logs (especially 'alerts' and 'h=
eritrix_out') for any errors
> that might explain a total freeze.
>
> The C=
andidatesProcessor runs the entire 'CandidatesChain' of
processors
> that p=
rocess each outlink (candidate URI), and ends with URIs being
> enqueued in=
to the frontier. To narrow down what might be happening it
> would help to =
see a few more representative stacks of exactly where
> multiple threads ar=
e held up -- from either the 'Threads Report' or
> Java's 'jstack' or -SIGQ=
UIT stack dumping.
>
> If those steps yield nothing obvious, knowing the OS=
 and JVM version
> could eventually become relevant.
>
> - Gordon
>
> On 9/=
20/12 5:13 AM, matteo.ceccarello@... wrote:
> > Hi all, I'm doing some test=
 to tweak the configuration of Heritrix
3.
> > The final goal is to make a =
large crawl (namely the entire .it
> > domain).
> >
> > The setup I'm using=
 for the test is a single machine with 12Gb of
> > RAM, 1Tb hard disk and 8=
 cores.
> >
> > Heritrix is configured with the default values, except that=
 the
> > UriUniqFilter is BloomUriUniqFilter.
> >
> > I've noticed that aft=
er a short time (more or less 3 hours) the
crawl
> > speed drops from 3000 =
KB/sec (reported by the Heritrix web
interface)
> > to 0. At the same time =
all threads are in the Candidates processor,
> > and they seem stuck there.=

> >
> > What can be the cause of this behaviour?
> >
> > Thank you very mu=
ch for you advices!
> >
> > Matteo
> >
> >
> >
> > ------------------------=
------------
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> >
> >
> >
>
